snippet: The drug, Surfaxin, which helps premature babies with their breathing, won approval on its fifth try.
abstract: Discovery Laboratories wins Food and Drug Administration approval for the drug Surfaxin, used for the prevention of respiratory distress syndrome, a potentially fatal breathing disorder affecting premature babies; approval comes on the pharmaceutical company's fifth try, going back to 2004.
lead_paragraph: The drug, Surfaxin, which helps premature babies with their breathing, won approval on its fifth try.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Backs Respiratory Distress Drug For Babies
headline.main: F.D.A. Backs Respiratory Distress Drug for Babies
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Backs Respiratory Distress Drug For Babies
